title: Some glyphs dont show up.
content:
Suddenly, the letter “i” and “n” doesn’t display themselves in InDesign, Illustrator etc.

If I try to recall what I did recently was to fix startpoints-macro from Adobe. There was also an update in InDesign which i run. Nothing else have I done, except from exporting the fonts in the same way I always do.  
The glyphs show themselves in FontLab, but not anymore in applications.

Anyone experience this problem? It’s driving me crazy.

 [‹ FL5 component position](http://web.archive.org/web/20080511225327/http:/www.typophile.com/node/33052 "Go to previous forum topic") [Kerning in OTF and InDesign ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080511225327/http:/www.typophile.com/node/32929 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Goran Soderstrom

comments.content:
Ok, i was to quick here. Problem solved.

Very strange, but when I changed the startpoints manually on the missing letters, they did show up again. Hmm, strange that the macro did this...  
Anyone knows what happened?
